column5: We are heading to Nakina on Friday and one individual has not purchased his license yet (Everyone else got theirs online). I told him we could stop on the way up and he can get it then. We will be going up through the Soo and I was wondering what the most convenient place for him to get it was. Does the Wallmart in the Soo sell them?

Lots of places to buy a license on the way but If your drive requires few stops on a tight schedule you can purchase a license at pennocks gas bar in Nakina. They are open daily usually quite early til about 9'or 10pm

As you go out of Soo, Ontario, stop at the Trading Post. Use credit card or Canadian cash. They don't give a very good exchange rate. Bought our bear tags there Friday a week ago. Quick and easy. In case you are not familiar with where they are , as the road goes from four lanes to two lanes , they are on the right . Have fun on your trip !!! I just can't get enough of Ontario , even after over 70 weeks in the past 30 years . Be safe and enjoy looking at Superior . Watch for moose . Saw numerous along the road from Soo to Wawa and more over to Thunder Bay .
The trading post about 10 mi n of Sault, Ontario. It is easy on and off of 17. I always stop there: gas supplies, tackle, etc.
the MNR website allows you to print out your license right after you pay for it - no need to stop anywhere. phish
That's the best way. It's in your hand before you leave.
Printing on line for fishing license is the easiest way. For Bear Tag I want their tag as it is waterproof.
